comments.commentBody: Ah  , but you forget . . . (purposely?)  He was trying to please everyone somewhat, without making one side absolutely ecstatic. He was also trying desperately to get some decent (?) Republicans on board, so the law would be harder or impossible to repeal - just like is happening now.  See how it works?
Oh, I wish that was my post . . .!  Perfect!
. . . and absolutely NO sense of humor.

"[Franklin Delano] Roosevelt was the one who had the vision to change our policy from isolationism to world leadership. That was a terrific revolution. Our country’s never been the same since."

—W. Averell Harriman

Donald Trump 2017: The anti-FDR !

"Let's go backward, America...for a brighter, whiter and isolated tomorrow."
Instead of "President Trump's Island Mentality," shouldn't the headline be "President Trump's Unstable Mentality?"

Planned Parenthood facilities have been closing around the country at a  fairly steady rate.  I think it is due to the successful campaign of the many pro-life groups promoting life.  Our efforts have not been in vain.

Absolutely, they are anti sex, else would understand the need for birth control. All judgments and no understanding of those needier than themselves, I find the "pro lifers" to be hypocritical selfish ideologues.
That's the point.  All you care about is somehow keeping score by counting clinics that you have closed down.  Women's lives don't matter.

Rachel - Los Angeles
I think that the "pro-lifers" deem that the "remedy" for coitus is a zygote.
Therefore, no coitus, no zygote.
Therefore, no need for contraceptive pills or devices of any kind.
Not my philosophy but perhaps, theirs.

Here's another metaphor . . .
A great architect (the Democrats/Obama) unknowingly hires a crooked contractor (the Republicans, who else?) who then go about exchanging top grade building materials for cheap knock-offs, pulling bricks out of the lower foundation to build Rube Goldberg fantasies on top. These people are the perfect dictionary examples of Luddites. They're like the Trading Places - Take your kid to work program where the dopey kid sits in the president's chair and mucks things up. But they're only there for a day; we're stuck with the republicans for at least four year. Thanx, dopey voters, for the great 'gift . . .'

Redesigning healthcare delivery/policy should be the next "Moon Shoot" - NASA's goal - SAFELY send and return men from the moon to back to earth. This effort required input of multiple, diverse experts, maximizing efficiently, meticulous planning, practice scenarios, minimizing the chances for error, contingency plans for problems seen and unforeseen while reasonably trying to keep cost under control.

Now, replace "while reasonably trying to keep cost under control" with "while maintaining a profit margin of ....", and I doubt a man would have ever set foot on the moon.

HEALTHCARE's goal - patient has access to care in a timely & efficient manner, within a facility meeting standards for patient safety and with adequate allotment of time for evaluation, treatment and dialogue with care provider. In addition, HEALTHCARE policy will provide and maintain the resources necessary for ongoing care & incentives for maintaining health and seeking preventative care while reasonably trying to keep cost under control.

Now, replace "while reasonably trying to keep cost under control" with "while maintaining a profit margin of ....",

Finally a post addressing the fact that the DEMs with a super majority in 2009 could only come up with a Republican plan, written by an Insurance executive!

And they even had single payer supporters arrested for trying to get a seat at Max Baucus' table discussing healh care reform.

Google: UHC yahoo finance and then look at the 'max' stock chart and you'll see how share price took off after 2010.

The ACA was a committee project that incorporated, or at least it tried to please insurance companies, medical/industrial complex and Republicans. So when all is said and done it is a Republican Goat. being the conservative goat they have no better solution then destroy the ACA. If they were truly concerned and had brass b*** they could introduce single payer health plan instead of Ryan's tax gimmick!

In the mid-60's my father I were fishing in the Adirondacks. One night we happened into Long Lake. My father, always the salesman, chatted up a local -- who informed him that the "pot problem" was probably worse there than it was in the leafy, upscale Hudson Valley town we came from.

It was a wake up call for us both. What neither of us had seen was the poverty beginning to spread across the small towns and cities of the country, in places that, while decidedly hardscrabble, had never known problems like this before.

You can fast forward to 2016. The drug of choice is an opioid, but the reasons are the same; poverty, depression, lack of opportunity, family disintegration. As a Democrat, I feel we have tried and tried (and often failed) to fix these pervasive problems. The folks in Indiana can blame the "coastal elites" all they want, but it hasn't been for a lack of trying. That they think that an actual "coastal elite" billionaire like Donald Trump can solve their problems (because he mocks me and my fellow travelers) is the wonder of our time...and the greatest of sorrows.

Sorry, Clyde, but all the money seems to go to the metro areas.  They can't just have an overpass --- they must have the columned bricked sort.  One area rots, while the other paints itself pretty.  Where I live, it might as well be Detroit.  While the money was good, they were all here.  But, as soon as it was gone - so were they.  Off to Florida and Arizona with the spoils.
I agree Clyde, Democrats have tried and tried to deal with this, and other problems only to find a cynical and malicious GOP stand in the way.

This is unhinged, even for donald trump. It sounds to me like he's panicking a bit. Trump, even as US President, could care less about Russians interfering with our election and illegally hacking US emails, which did actually happen, but he trashes the prior US president and calls him "sick" over something he pulled out of his Breitbart.

Trump has got to go. This is beyond reckless.
Poorly written arguments, not founded in facts. Frowny-face emoji.
Sounds like you're still waiting to see Obama's long-form birth certificate. You should probably mention this to your doctor during your next check-up.

Yesterday we had the Russian connection reports implicating those on Trumps staff... Today he does his usual deflection.. guess what, hes got the american public looking for a wiretap on his phone put their by obama? with nothing more than a letter from Brietbart (Bannon)... come on ppl. pay attention to whats really going on

Trump, his administration, and with it the country are ever more quickly spinning out of control.  Wasn't it just a second or two ago that Trump was receiving high praise for his speech before Congress?  There is a desperation in the air.  If Congress doesn't act to stabilize this increasing bizarre situation...well, how do you think it's all going to end.   Seriously, how?  There is no way this chaos can continue indefinitely without some serious consequences to our government and to our society.

We are seeing the destabilization already - post-election rallies, demonstrations on the streets, riled up angry citizens, senseless cuts to important programs, government employees on edge, questionable senior appointments, reckless unfounded statements, attacks on the pillars of democracy - judicial, freedom of the press, legitimacy of election system.  It has created an uncivil society and is borderline incitement to civil war.  Is this all to assuage one man's monster ego?

To the New York times and the media, please keep your eye on the Prize:Russia intervention in the U.S election.
Mr Trump is getting scared now that his most ardent supporter the A.G has recused himself.
Do not be distracted by Trump tweets.

Yes! And there is probably more.  The media has to do its job.  BUT is part of its job exposing his possible imbalance?  Do not give each utterance the free publicity of the campaign.  A new EO on travel and a Muslim ban is coming--CNN says maybe on Monday. Report on that.  His tweets maybe a diversion to shield the important stuff...

Exactly. Read the New Yorker article of Putin's rise to power and his control of government, through fake news, gerrymandering, and alleged murder...

Trump even uses the same phrases pioneered by Putin. Stay on the Russia story!
How's the weather in Moscow, Dave?
Mr. President, We aren't stupid. Please stop this nonsense and get on with governing the country. Please.
He is counting on Americans being stupid.

If you think it is at all possible that he is capable of governing the country then I strongly disagree with the premise of your first sentence. When the public realizes the horror, it will be impeachment time. He just needs more rope.
...and that he and the Republicans are incapable of governing the country.

Trump is an illegitimate president. The sooner America gets rid of him - through impeachment/conviction or by use of the 25th Amendment - the better for all of us in this world.

And he owes President Obama and the Office of the President a big, fat apology.

Obama denied ordering the tap.

Obama did not deny that he knew the tapping was being done.

The Democrats were doing the tapping in an attempt to get something on President Trump and save Clinton's campaign--they failed and whether there was any legal justification for the tap remains to be seen.

Some Democrat might be facing charges on this for requesting a tap with false justification.

I wonder if it's like the writer's room for a show? I can see them sitting around the Oval Office going we need a new diversion tweet for this week's Russia cycle...

I've got one: how about 'Obama tapped my phones'!

Great! Love it! Put it out tonight and I'll see you guys on Monday.

For a moment, think about what you're saying. Because you believe that Obama would violate any law he saw obstructing his access to information, you now suggest that Trump can make any claim consistent with that and be required to offer no evidence, and you're just fine with that. Does that stance truly make sense to you? Anything that can be true, is true, even with no evidence to support it.

Change the story change the lead. Marines get killed in Lebanon, invade Grenada. Anything to cover for a soon to be former attorney general who should be prosecuted for perjury.
We are always dealing with Trump on a last in first out inventory basis. He does something stupid today to distract from yesterday's stupidity.
A "birther" called Hobbes would like to see your long-form certificate just one more time, Mr. Obama.
Somewhere there is a second grade teacher ruing the day she told Donald that anyone can become a President, even those who failed spelling.
And a one syllable word at that!
